Message.Title: AMD hires a chip design superstar
Message.Msg: I wonder if AMD will be around long enough to enjoy any benefit. Very good guy with outstanding creds though. Must have been quite an offer to move him from AAPL. They want him to single handedly design AMD out of their incredibly deep hole. The package must be enormous. The move also might be an interesting peek into what the future holds for aapl's roadmap in the chip biz. 2-3 years, maybe 4, before any results, and gigantic challenges ahead. Good luck Jim. http://allthingsd.com/20120801/amd-hires-apples-head-chip-designer/?reflink=ATD_yahoo_ticker

Topic.Title: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 650 Ti Specifications Leaked

Message.Msg: Another segment for Kepler to dominate. With NVDA's understanding of TSMC, and the architectural lead in this product, I predict this is an overclockable screamer that will crush anything that dares to toe the water in the perf/midrange space. Laptop and add in OEMs are going to have a field day. And by 2H NVDA should get their bigger margins back on track.

Message.Title: Chances Apple tries to buy Nvidia?
Message.Msg: I know Nvidia has no interest in being bought out, especially given the current momentum that seems to be building around the Tegra line. But everyone, including Jen, has his price. And one would think, maybe in a couple of years, that Apple, with its huge cash hoard, would try to acquire the company, no? By then, we could be looking at a $20 or $30 billion deal. Seems to make more sense then, say, Intel making a bid. Thoughts?

Topic.Title: Shouldn't Jen be announcing an acquisition?

Message.Msg: - It's interesting, right? It sure is. This little cat-and-mouse game Jennie is playing with Best. Best (the Cat) thinks that Jennie is dying to announce a shiny new acquisition right before his disasterous quarterly report. Gives the bagholders something to look forward to, right? Other than reduced guidance as the entire semiconductor industry slides into an economic decline for the next six (6) months. But Jennie (the Mouse) won't give Best the satisfaction of so accurately predicting his acquisition timing. Like, almost to the day. So Jennie keeps delaying his acquisition announcement, hoping the folks forget Best's prognistication of an acquisition. Unfortunately, there's now only six (6) trading days left for Jennie before "earnings". And Best keeps reposting this thread. "Drats. Foiled again", curses Jennie. But really now -- doesn't an observant Cat always get the Mouse? -

Topic.Title: Shouldn't Jen be announcing an acquisition?

Message.Msg: - So Best? When Jennie finally concedes, and announces that shiny new acquisition, that will make you the Best Ever Predictor in the History of this Board, right? It sure will. NOBODY has ever accurately predicted an acquisition before. -
